comment._content: USS Mayflower (PY-1) Patrol Yacht - 1. Used as Presidential Yacht intermittantly from 25 July 1905 to 22 March 1929 Ship's history here: www.ibiblio.org/hyperwar/USN/ships/dafs/WPG/wpg183.html

comment._content: a completely documented account of this! Monday October 14, 1912, query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?res=9D02E4DD133CE6...

comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: USS Mayflower (PY-1) (later as USCG Mayflower (WPG-183)) was the second ship in the United States Navy to have that name. Mayflower — a luxurious steam yacht built in 1896 by J. and G. Thompson, Clydebank, Scotland — was purchased by the Navy from the estate of Ogden Goelet and commissioned at New York Navy Yard on 24 March 1898, Commander M. R. S. McKensie in command. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/USS_Mayflower_(PY-1)
